lead_paragraph: KASTENBAUM--Sydell, of Boca Raton, FL and New York, died on March 16th at the age of 89. Sydell was a strong woman whose feisty spirit helped her to endure life's travails no matter how big or small. Sydell married her sweetheart, Sidney, and together for over 60 years they shared a love affair of support and admiration. Her sons were the center of her universe and her greatest joy came from witnessing their successes whether on an athletic field or at their dental /medical school graduations. She was a dedicated wife and mother who respected and loved her family unconditionally. She was also a staunch supporter of Israel and worked tirelessly for many Jewish causes including UJA and Hadassah. Sydell lived a long, happy life in Lawrence, LI, and Florida, and in her final years remained in New York close to her family. She is survived by her children Fred and Karen, Donald and Cindie, and her grandchildren Julie, Harry, Frankie and Daniel, and her great-grandson Roman. Funeral Services Friday, March 18th at "The Riverside," 76th St., and Amsterdam Ave. Donations may be made in her memory at ujafedny.org or to UJA-Federation of New York, 130 E. 59th St., NY, NY 10022 1/3
